items.title: More efficient use of raw materials with the aid of 'molecular conveyor belts'
items.summary: Making valuable products, such as fuels, synthetic materials or pharmaceuticals, from renewable raw materials is to date not efficient enough because the microorganisms used only process the raw materials very slowly and generate many by-products in addition to the substances actually wanted. Biotechnologists have now succeeded in optimizing sugar utilization in baker's yeast.

alternate.title: More efficient use of raw materials with the aid of 'molecular conveyor belts'

items.title: Antimalarial drug combined with light sensitive molecules for promising treatment of cancer
items.summary: Scientists have discovered that a combination of artemisinin, which is a potent anti-malarial drug, and aminolaevulinic acid, which is a photosensitizer, could kill colorectal cancer cells and suppress tumor growth more effectively than administering artemisinin alone. This novel combination therapy could also have fewer side effects.

alternate.title: Antimalarial drug combined with light sensitive molecules for promising treatment of cancer

items.title: Welfare of zoo animals set to improve
items.summary: The wellbeing of zoological animals is set to improve following the successful trial of a new welfare assessment grid.

alternate.title: Welfare of zoo animals set to improve

thumbnail.title: Welfare of zoo animals set to improve

items.title: Cells programmed like computers to fight disease
items.summary: Cells can be programmed like a computer to fight cancer, influenza, and other serious conditions -- thanks to a breakthrough in synthetic biology.

alternate.title: Cells programmed like computers to fight disease

thumbnail.title: Cells programmed like computers to fight disease

items.title: New evidence for small, short-lived drops of early universe quark-gluon plasma?
items.summary: Particles emerging from even the lowest energy collisions of small deuterons with large heavy nuclei at the Relativistic Heavy Ion Collider exhibit behavior scientists associate with the formation of a soup of quarks and gluons, the fundamental building blocks of nearly all visible matter.

alternate.title: New evidence for small, short-lived drops of early universe quark-gluon plasma?

thumbnail.title: New evidence for small, short-lived drops of early universe quark-gluon plasma?
